text:
The updates for 21H2 and 22H2 are exactly the same size and download the exact
same file. If you observe a difference in size in the catalog, it is probably
related to architecture differences (x86, x64, ARM64). Jody MacKercher Positron
Computer Services

metadata.topic: Re: KB5034957: Updating the WinRE partition on deployed devices to address security vulnerabilities in CVE-2024-20666
metadata.subject: RE: [patchmanagement] Re: KB5034957: Updating the WinRE partition on deployed devices to address security vulnerabilities in CVE-2024-20666
metadata.email_text_original:
The updates for 21H2 and 22H2 are exactly the same size and download the exact
same file. If you observe a difference in size in the catalog, it is probably
related to architecture differences (x86, x64, ARM64). Jody MacKercher Positron
Computer Services -----Original Message----- From:
patchmanagement@googlegroups.com On Behalf Of Shawn K. Hall Sent: Wednesday,
January 17, 2024 1:23 AM To: patchmanagement@googlegroups.com Subject: RE:
[patchmanagement] Re: KB5034957: Updating the WinRE partition on deployed
devices to address security vulnerabilities in CVE-2024-20666 I do, but they're
not the same. There's enough different about them that each of the releases for
Safe OS for 21H2 and 22H2 are significantly different sizes. Microsoft are the
ones that wrote the script and released the update specifically to exclude
2004/20H1 and 2009/20H2. I'm just pointing out what it says in the actual
release information. Safe OS updates for 2004 aren't listed in the catalog
either:
https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.catalog.update.microsoft.com%2FSearch.aspx%3Fq%3DSafe%2520OS&data=05%7C02%7Cemail_ingestion%40bighatgroup.com%7C2045721580a0442adad508dc175ffe2b%7C5a01497e1bcb4711b6e6d24f4ab00393%7C0%7C0%7C638410948254771455%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=NcJWZSY0OLe57z8lIFnkfM8Px4m1lsGIM1Djp7Lv6Vs%3D&reserved=0
It's possible that the 21H2 or 22H2 updates will work, but each of them are
different sizes so I wouldn't trust it. -S
Link: None
